sections.title: Collaboration between Big Red Shuttle and Cornell AppDev
sections.summary: In order to help the Big Red Shuttle fulfill its mission in providing safe, free, and late-night transportation to the Cornell community, the Cornell AppDev project team designed and developed this iOS application.

sections.title: Cornell AppDev
sections.summary: Cornell AppDev is an engineering project team at Cornell University dedicated to open-source mobile and web application development. The team consists of talented iOS/Android developers, backend developers, and designers who collaborate to bring projects to life. AppDev members work in a startup-like environment and gain practical experience in software development, design, and product management.

sections.title: Big Red Shuttle
sections.summary: The Big Red Shuttle is Cornell's first free, student-run, late-night transportation service for students in need of a safe ride home. It strives to promote a safer campus climate to prevent alcohol-related incidents and sexual assault. The Big Red Shuttle runs a 20-minute route every Friday and Saturday night from 12am-3am with a professional paid driver and two managers trained by Cayuga's Watchers.
